action.primary: Invigorates the Blood, reduces abdominal masses, cools the Blood and unblocks the menses

indications: Dysmenorrhea or amenorrhea due to Blood Stasis
Abdominal masses (can be used as a stand-alone herb in decoction chased by warm wine)
Severe sore throat, throat Bi, and other accumulations of Heat toxin including breast abscess (use the macerated fresh herb), swollen, painful gums

action.primary: Facilitates urination and checks malarial disorders

indications: Internal blockage of Dampness with edema or ascites

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Spleen Yin Deficiency.
Contraindicated for those with Stomach Qi Deficiency.

useCases: Dysmenorrhea and amenorrhea due to Blood Stasis.

notes: It is particularly effective when when Blood Stasis is due to Blood Heat drying and congealing the Blood.
It can be applied topically for wounds involving metal, also for swollen sores.
One source says that in alleviates Damp-Heat diarrhea.
